00025 
00026 #ifndef SDBX_RTREE_NODE_H
00027 #define SDBX_RTREE_NODE_H
00028 
00029 #ifdef USE_MSVC_MEMORY_TRACING
00030         // this enables advanced memory leak detection
00031         #include <wx/msw/msvcrt.h>
00032 #endif
00033 
00034 
00043 template <typename _Item, std::size_t _max_items>
00044 struct RTreeNode : public TreeNodeBase {
00045 
00046         typedef _Item                                                   Item;
00047         typedef std::vector < Item >                    ItemArray;
00048         typedef typename _Item::IdType                  IdType;
00049 
00050         
00051         bool            is_dirty;               
00052 
00053 
00054                                                                 
00055         ItemArray       items;                  
00056 
00057         // default constructor
00058         RTreeNode() : is_dirty(true) 
00059         {
00060                 // reduce memory allocations
00061                 items.reserve(_max_items+1);
00062         }
00063         
00064         
00066         enum {  
00067                         max_items = _max_items,
00068                         record_size = 
00069                                 sizeof(uint16_t) +                                      // array count
00070                                 _max_items * record<Item>::size         // array
00071         };
00072 
00073         
00075         explicit RTreeNode(const unsigned char * const buffer) :
00076                 is_dirty(false)
00077         {
00078                 unsigned char * cur_buf = (unsigned char *)(buffer + sizeof(uint16_t));
00079                 
00080                 // reduce memory allocations: max+1 because of splits
00081                 items.reserve(_max_items+1);
00082                 
00083                 // grab the count
00084                 std::size_t count = BUFFER_REF(uint16_t, 0);
00085                 assert(count <= _max_items && "corruption in file");
00086                 
00087                 for (std::size_t i = 0; i < count; i++)
00088                 {
00089                         // add the item, move to the next spot in the buffer
00090                         items.push_back(Item(record<Item>::deserialize(cur_buf)));
00091                         cur_buf += record<Item>::size;
00092                 }
00093         }
00094         
00095         
00097         void Serialize(unsigned char * buffer) const
00098         {
00099                 // serialize each node
00100                 assert(items.size() <= _max_items);
00101                 
00102                 typename ItemArray::const_iterator i = items.begin();
00103                 const typename ItemArray::const_iterator e = items.end();
00104                 
00105                 // write the size
00106                 SERIALIZE(uint16_t, 0, (uint16_t)items.size());
00107                 buffer += sizeof(uint16_t);
00108                 
00109                 // write the array
00110                 for (; i != e; i++)
00111                 {
00112                         i->Serialize(buffer);
00113                         buffer += Item::record_size;
00114                 }
00115         }
00116 
00117         // utility function
00118         IdType get_item_id(std::size_t idx)
00119         {
00120                 if (idx < items.size())
00121                         return items[idx].id;
00122                 
00123                 return NULL;
00124         }
00125 };
00126 
00127 
00128 #endif
